On Thu, Dec 14, 2017 at 12:43 PM, marek-krcal ***@***.***> wrote: Thanks for a prompt reply. What exactly is "non-constant" initializer? when I tried: w = tf.Variable(tf.random_uniform((2000,1000000),dtype=dtype), trainable=False,dtype='float32') with tf.Session() as sess: sess.run(tf.global_variables_initializer()) gives me ResourceExhaustedError (OOM) on GTX 1080 with 11GB of memory (tensor is 8GB large). (Sorry for for perhaps a silly question, I am a complete layman in TF) — You are receiving this because you were mentioned.  Thanks for a prompt reply. What exactly is "non-constant" initializer?
 when I tried:
 w = tf.Variable(tf.random_uniform((2000,1000000),dtype=dtype),
 trainable=False,dtype='float32') with tf.Session() as sess:
 sess.run(tf.global_variables_initializer())
 gives me ResourceExhaustedError (OOM) on GTX 1080 with 11GB of memory
 (tensor is 8GB large).

 (Sorry for for perhaps a silly question, I am a complete layman in TF)
